formattedAddress: Weill Cornell Medicine, 1321 York, Ground Floor, York Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: Weill Cornell Medicine, 1321 York, Ground Floor, York Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text: I could no longer afford my beloved doctor of 25 years because she didn't take insurance. Her office recommended Dr. Taylor after I had tried several doctors I did not like.  She is empathic and thorough.  Highly recommend.

text.text: I could no longer afford my beloved doctor of 25 years because she didn't take insurance. Her office recommended Dr. Taylor after I had tried several doctors I did not like.  She is empathic and thorough.  Highly recommend.

originalText.text: Dr. Taylor is the best primary care physician I've ever had. She's intelligent, kind, and thorough. I've always been able to get a same-day appointment for sick visits. I've never felt rushed during a visit, nor have I ever waited very long to be seen. I highly recommend her.

text.text: Dr. Taylor is the best primary care physician I've ever had. She's intelligent, kind, and thorough. I've always been able to get a same-day appointment for sick visits. I've never felt rushed during a visit, nor have I ever waited very long to be seen. I highly recommend her.

originalText.text:
I had the most pleasant experience with Dr. Taylor. She made me feel so comfortable, was incredibly informative, and open-minded. She provided all the referrals I asked for and even gave me some resources to find other doctors on my own. Dr. Taylor has such a bubbly personality and a really down-to-earth outlook on women's health. I felt well taken care of, well informed, and prepared to make clear decisions for my health.

The check in/check out process was also a dream. So easy and the staff is friendly. They were right on time. I talking down to the second right on time. My appointment was at 10am, and I was pulled in at that exact time and out by 10:30.

Highly highly recommend and will be telling all my friends about her!!

text.text:

originalText.text: As a patient, you should not be punished for the life-happening events around you.  If you feel you need to receive punitive treatment the nurse and Dr. Taylor will definitely do that here. I have been a patient for a few years and have continued to always wait at my appointments. I could be early and still wait to be seen. I always thought going to a prestigious hospital, one that people raved about, I would get the best care, and they would focus on my needs. I have learned, just because a practice is linked to a prestigious hospital, does not mean the treatment is the same. Over the years, I am sure Dr. Taylor has many new patients now but she has lost her way as a true caregiving physician. At one point I could speak to her and now, I feel she has no respect for her patients. I went from receiving great service to being spoken to as if I was a child and today I have seen the true Emily Taylor. I do not wish this treatment on anyone. If you wish to have ill -bedside manners given to you, this is the place to go. People should not be punished for coming to their appointments late, the least the staff should have done was state "due to the heavy schedule, would you like to reschedule." I cannot believe how instead I receive an unprofessional response. It is disturbing to me that I was treated poorly in this practice.

originalText.text: Excellent MD - caring, thorough and non-judgmental. Goes out of her way and really cares about your well being. Great nurse and team to support her practice. Highly recommend.
